title: npm run prettier behaves inconsistently between local and CI

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: Melvin Triage
labels.description: Automatic AI Analysis of an issue

body:
## Problem

Running `npm run prettier` locally reports success and doesn't make or report any changes, but CI fails with "Prettier diff detected" on the same file. The local and CI prettier behavior is inconsistent.

This could be caused by different prettier/node versions, different config being picked up, or something in `scripts/runPrettier.sh` behaving differently between environments.

Example workflow failure: https://github.com/Expensify/App/actions/runs/22363352177/job/64722629957

## Solution

Investigate why prettier behaves differently locally vs CI. Ensure `npm run prettier` produces the same results in both environments.

**Workaround**: Run `npx prettier --write <file>` directly on the affected file instead of using `npm run prettier`.

cc @Expensify/mobile-deployers

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Problem The test is flaky [as reported here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/83310#issuecomment-3951604211). `screen.findByTestId('search-autocomplete-text-input')` at `tests/ui/SearchPageTest.tsx:119` times out on CI because the search autocomplete input doesn't render within the default async timeout. The test passes locally. ## Solution Determine the root cause and fix it.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.25-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-6152/folder/13176706/41236849/1207856089?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ccardfeed@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Windows 11 Home/Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: - Login applausetester+ccardfeed@applause.expensifail.com 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to Navigate to the workspace "Company Cards tests - DO NOT DELETE!" 3. Navigate to Company Cards 4. Open VISA feed 5. Click on Settings 6. Disable Allow deleting transactions 7. Go back to Company Card feed 8. Find *2143 card 9. Open card RHN 10. Click 'View transactions' 11. Select 1 transaction 12. Delete it by using 'x selected' menu 13. Enable Allow deleting transactions 14. Repeat Step 7 - 13 ## Expected Result: User should not able to delete card transactions: At step 12: Verify it cannot be deleted, since deleting transactions is disabled At step 14: Verify it still can’t be deleted since it was imported prior the settings change ## Actual Result: User can delete some card transactions from Reports page. User unable to delete transactions in Workspace chat ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfa7753c-6feb-490b-99d2-9ca486737695 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] [Performance] Move search bulk actions logic to a custom hook

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
Problem When navigating to the Reports page (e.g. from LHB), SearchPage is a god component that handles bulk actions logic within the component even though it doesn't need that logic until a user selects items. Solution Create a `useSearchBulkActions` hook, move all bulk action logic inside the hook. Additionally, create a new component `SearchBulkActionsButton`, conditionally rendering it if any items are selected. `SearchBulkActionsButton` will then call the `useSearchBulkActions` hook to setup the available actions
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @truph01

title: [$250] Expense - Different destination opens when bulk merging vs merging individually

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.25-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79766 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsodjsodnjoisjdosij@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create an expense in self DM. 3. Create an expense in workspace chat. 4. Go to Reports > Expenses. 5. Open the workspace expense. 6. Click More > Merge. 7. Select self DM expense > Continue. 8. Select second option in each section > Next > Merge expenses. → Transaction thread opens. 9. Create an expense in self DM. 10. Create an expense in workspace chat. 11. Go to Reports > Expenses. 12. Select workspace expense via checkbox. 13. Click dropdown button > Merge. 14. Select self DM expense > Continue. 15. Select second option in each section > Next > Merge expenses. ## Expected Result: Transaction thread will open after merging expenses via bulk option (similar to Step 8). ## Actual Result: Self DM opens after merging expenses via bulk option. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aef54d64-c740-4fa5-9d8c-7dbacf9d3857 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
